text: The Château de la Johannie is an historic castle in Curemonte, Corrèze, Nouvelle-Aquitaine, France. ==History== It was built circa 1308 on an old house built in 1083.French Ministry of Culture: Château de la Johannie It belonged to Hugues de Jean in the 14th century.Annick Tulasne-Moeneclaey, Les châteaux de Corrèze, Paris : Nouvelles éditions latines, 1997, p. 19 It stayed in the Jean family (later known as the Johannie family) until 1498, when it was acquired by Jacques Vassal, who owned 1/7th of Curemonte. It was acquired by Mathieu Brun in 1623, followed by the Dambert family. It was acquired by the Plas family in 1693. ==Architectural significance== It has been listed as an official monument since 1981. ==References== Category:Castles in Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:Monuments historiques of Nouvelle-Aquitaine
title: Château de la Johannie
